title: Micheál Martin - Wikipedia
snippet: Martin was awarded "Politician of the Year" by the Journal for his performance and election result. He was elected again as Taoiseach in a 95–76 vote by the Dáil on 23 January 2025 following a coalition agreement between Fianna Fáil, Fine Gael and with the support of several independent TDs.

title: Micheál Martin returns as Irish premier, bracing for Trump fallout | Reuters
snippet: Item 1 of 2 Taoiseach Micheal Martin reacts as he is elected as Ireland's Taoiseach (Prime Minister) in parliamentary vote, in Dublin, Ireland, January 23, 2025.

title: Micheál Martin hits back at criticism of Irish presidential election review
snippet: Taoiseach Micheál Martin has been under pressure since Jim Gavin dropped out of the Irish presidential race earlier this year

title: Micheál Martin finally appoints his new Cabinet amid temporary Dáil ceasefire – The Irish Times
snippet: After being elected Taoiseach by 95 votes to 76, Micheál Martin was cheered to the rafters by both Fianna Fáil and Fine Gaelers. Photograph: Maxwell's · Pat Leahy · Thu Jan 23 2025 - 18:09 · An uneasy, and perhaps only interim, ceasefire between Government and Opposition parties enabled the election of Micheál Martin as Taoiseach and the formation of a new Government today after an acrimonious 24-hour delay that deepened the divisions in the 34th Dáil and soured relations across the floor of the House to an extent that feels more than temporary.

title: Micheál Martin vows to protect Ireland ‘at moment of real threat’ | Ireland | The Guardian
snippet: Fianna Fáil leader officially elected as taoiseach a day after chaotic scenes in Dáil, as thoughts turn to future and Trump
